channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump Jr. tells East Europe to pick the U.S. over China for deals
item.description: Trump Jr. is holding a roadshow called “Trump Business Vision 2025.”

item.title: Google says Chrome will suffer if it’s forced to sell the world’s most popular web browser
item.description: “I don’t think it could be recreated,” Chrome's general manager said about its success under Google.

item.title: Tesla hikes Canadian prices and pushes its pre-tariff inventory
item.description: Tesla's Canadian website says: “Explore pre-tariff priced inventory while supplies last.”

item.title: Silicon Valley’s intense energy demands for AI are making coal-fired power plants a hot-ticket item again
item.description: Tech companies are eyeing coal-fired power plants headed for retirement because of their connections to the grid that a new power plant could use.

item.title: Kevin Hart says there’s one thing still worth splurging on in this uncertain economy, regardless of income level
item.description: With consumer confidence down and market volatility up, Americans are tightening their belts right now.

item.title: If a financial adviser wants to roll over your retirement savings, watch out
It’s time to buy tech stocks: 4 ways to find winners while the market is down
‘Bond king’ Jeffrey Gundlach predicts our next financial hangover—it's sobering
What Trump’s next 100 days will mean for taxes, markets and your wallet
Kevin Warsh says the Fed is broken. He’s taking dead aim at Powell’s job.
